info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 10:13AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...An intense snow shower will impact portions of southeastern Missoula and north central Granite Counties through 1100 AM MDT... At 1011 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an intense snow shower near Bonner-West Riverside, or 13 miles east of Missoula, moving northeast at 55 mph. A few showers will slide over I-90 east of Missoula through 11am potentially producing moderate snow. HAZARD...Visibility one-half mile or less and creating slick spots. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Locations impacted include... Bonner-West Riverside, Nimrod, Clinton and Turah. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 110 and 136. Highway 200 between mile markers 1 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
